630 sq ft Studio for $2375/month (including water and garbage) for 12-month lease including assigned, off-street, covered parking. Building is located at 412 Monte Vista at Oakland Ave bordering the Piedmont boundary line. 

This 1908 historical building was recently restored to its magnificent original charm in a renovation recognized by the Oakland Heritage Alliance with a Partners in Preservation Award (http://www.oaklandheritage.org/412-monte-vista.html). It is conveniently located for work and play, situated within a short walk of the shopping, dining, and nightlife of Piedmont Avenue (0.4 mi) and the Grand Lake District (0.3 mi), and only 0.5 miles from I-580 and 9.5 miles from downtown San Francisco. It also is excellently situated for public transportation:
Casual Carpool pickup at Monte Vista Ave and Oakland Ave - 0.1 mi
AC Transit local bus route 11 stop at Monte Vista Ave and Oakland Ave - 0.1 mi
AC Transit Transbay bus service pickup at Oakland Ave and MacArthur Ave - 0.4 mi 
MacArthur BART - 1.2 mi

The unit itself is a work of art with original craftsmanship throughout, including an intricate wood inlay on the floors, redwood wainscot on the walls, and ornate crown molding on the ceiling, all bordering the entire room (see pictures). This first-floor, 630-square-foot unit has separate alcove with renovated galley kitchen, bathroom, and closet. The space has several large windows with lots of bright natural light, newly installed, designer window coverings (not pictured), and gas fireplace with stone hearth and redwood mantlepiece. 

Unit comes with one assigned, covered parking spot and and an individual storage space. The building features onsite laundry with multiple washers and dryers. 

Walkscore.com gives 412 Monte Vista a Walkscore of 76 - "Very Walkable - Most errands can be accomplished on foot" and a Personal Crime Grade of A - "Lowest Crime Area". https://www.walkscore.com/score/412-monte-vista-ave-oakland-ca-94611

2555 Le Conte Ave
Berkeley, CA 94709

2555 Le Conte is a 29 unit complex offering a mix of studios, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments. This fabulous cottage style building boasts unique architectural features, a stout turret, mullion
windows, wood trim accents, and a shared stone patio. The complex has a huge gated parking structure with plentiful off street parking, an onsite laundry room with multiple machines, bike parking and phone intercom system. 


The layouts are unique and the details are stunning. Some
have exposed brick, high ceilings or rustic wood beams; others have private
decks or balconies ideal for a quiet moment or a book you've been meaning to
finish. The majority of the Le Conte apartments are super spacious with hardwood
floors and outstanding architectural design.




The Le Conte Avenue Apartments is one of North Berkeley's jewels. A quiet charming building built in the 1920's can boast not only great architectural features but also a fantastic location. Each unit has hardwood floors, high ceilings, gas kitchens, and great windows.

The building is only 2 blocks away from the North Gate of Campus, and the cool shops on Euclid Avenue. Walk to campus, Buses closeby and the North Shattuck Gourmet Area dining and cafes galore.


Location

Enjoy the "Small-Town feel and worldly culture of Berkeley's "Gourmet Ghetto"

Just two blocks from your home is the renown eating establishments of the Gourmet Area, two major grocery stores, the serenity of Alone Park and all the venues of Downtown Berkeley. You are far enough from downtown that you don't have to deal with the noise and traffic, but you are close enough to "visit" anytime. The East Bay Express Describes the Area as: "The area is pleasant, with its central boulevard, Shattuck Avenue, bordered by trees. Many businesses have sidewalk tables, and a casual, leisurely mood prevails. You could wander for hours in the morning, just sampling coffee and pastries here and there." 

Some of the long-time, world-class establishments of the Gourmet Ghetto include:


Chez Panisse - Named Best Restaurant in United States by Gourmet Magazine
Peet's Coffee - The very first Peet's! 
Cheese Board Collective/Pizza - Whatever cheese you want, they have it. Great pizza too! 
French Hotel Cafe - A hip gathering place for coffee and pastries. 
North Berkeley Wine - Fixture of the Gourmet Ghetto with the best of wines 
Virginia Bakery - Old-Fashioned Bakery of 50 years! They sell cookies by the pound! 
Chester's Bayview Cafe - Have waffles for breakfast, pasta for lunch and catfish for dinner! 

Neighborhood InformationNeighborhood
The Le Conte Walk Apartments are perfect for someone who wants to be centrally located and super close to UC Berkeley on the highly desirable North side of Campus. The UC Berkeley campus and the Engineering Building are literally a half block away. The North side of Berkeley tends
to attract graduate students, university faculty, and Berkeley residents; however undergraduate especially engineering students are drawn to the area as well. 
Downtown Berkeley, BART and the Gourmet Ghetto are just a 5 minute walk away and the UC Berkeley Campus is just a 2 minute walk. Just down the street are the Holy Hill institutions and the Graduate Theological Union.
The location is just one block to the great shops on Euclid Avenue and you can easily grab a great cup of coffee at one of the numerous coffee houses in route to the campus. Great restaurants and cafes include Bongo Burger, La Val's Pizza, Euclid Cafe, Hummingbird cafe, Celia's Cafe, and Top Dog. 
The North side of campus is the place to be for Everything nd is also considered one of the safest areas in Berkeley.

The Channing Campus apartments are centrally located within Berkeley and 5 minutes to downtown Berkley and super close to the UC Campus. The apartments feature 3 and 4 bedroom floor plans
with a huge underground gated parking garage. The building has 4
levels equipped with an elevator and 2 stair cases on the front & rear of
each floor. Top level floor has a stunning penthouse suite which boasts a
panoramic view of the City of Berkley as well as the San Francisco Bay. Many of
the apartments have been remodeled with granite kitchen countertops, cherry
wood cabinets and hardwood floors. There is an on site laundry room and bike
storage room at the rear of the property.


Currently we have a single room available within a 4 bedroom apartment in the well sought after Channing Building.This terrific private room is just one of four rooms located on the first floor of the building in Unit #6. There's full access to a shared kitchen, bathroom and comfortable study area. The 4 rooms share one bathroom. The location is perfect!

Neighborhood InformationNeighborhood Description
The Channing Campus Apartments are perfect for someone who wants to be centrally located to Downtown Berkeley, BART and the UC Berkeley Campus. Day to day living is made easy with the Berkeley Bowl grocery store only a short walk away and an even shorter drive. Nearby coffee shops include Heat Cafe, Royal Ground
Coffee and Pipeline coffee. Nearby restaurants include Amazing Crab, Extreme
Pizza and La Note Restaurant Provencal. 
2020 Channing Way is near the M L King Jr. Civic Center Park, Edwards Track Stadium/Goldman Field and the Old City Hall Complex. There are excellent bike lanes and the terrain is flat and it's a short bike ride to the UC Berkeley Campus. Car sharing is available from City
CarShare, Zipcar and Getaround.
